oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Oliver Rodgers to his sister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Oliver Rodgers to his sister, dated April 11, 1865, Blew Springs, Tenn. Oliver writes of Gen. Lee surrendering his army to Gen. Grant. "Col. Russell was at Midway [probably Greene Co.] and heard the firing in the camp and thought that we was atacted [sic]." The soldiers were possibly celebrating the end of the war. Rodgers was a member of Co. G, 44th Ill. Vol. Inf., USA. See whit023 & whit025 for photographs of Oliver Rodgers.
